## SDQ vs ITQ

In the field of psychology and social sciences, the comparative analysis of different questionnaires such as the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and the International Trauma Questionnaire (ITQ) is a frequent practice. This process allows for a better understanding of psychological characteristics, behaviours, and experiences, often assisting in formulating robust, evidence-based outcomes. However, routinely, comparing instruments like SDQ vs ITQ can be a draining and time-consuming task. Enter Harmony - an advanced tool powered by natural language processing and generative AI models, designed to facilitate the harmonisation of questionnaire items.

## Harmony: The Superlative Tool for SDQ vs ITQ Comparison

Harmony revolutionizes how SDQ vs ITQ comparisons are made. It uses large language models to compare various instruments and can provide a percentage match between each item in SDQ and ITQ. It's not limited to these two instruments but extends to any you choose from Harmony's vast database. You can even upload your questionnaires in PDF form through its user-friendly web interface. The power of Harmony goes beyond language barriers - it efficiently compares items in multiple languages, enhancing its global applicability and usefulness.

## Compare the items in SDQ and ITQ

## SDQ vs ITQ: Making Comparisons Effortless with Harmony

To streamline your SDQ vs ITQ comparison process, Harmony is the tool you need. Its innovative approach to harmonisation makes comparisons swift, accurate, and less strenuous. By selecting or uploading your instruments, you can quickly get a percentage match for each item. This simplification allows you to focus more on data interpretation and less on matching items manually.
